pages.text: The mushroom cow has only rarely been seen and is therefore little researched. It has fungus-like red skin with white dots, and mushrooms sprout from the back. The milk has a mushroom flavor if milked only a little. Upon closer examination, some fungi were removed from the back, but this resulted in the fungal infection regressing and it became indistinguishable from a normal cow.
How a cow becomes $(l:myths/animal_infection)infected with a fungus$() is unexplored.

Texts surviving from the Ancient Kingdom speak of a mushroom cow secreting a strange stew that gives various effects to those who consume it. However, this cow was brown and is said to find its way on earth only through $(o)Thor's powers$().
